ground_truth: Holly, excited, runs over to April, who is busy taking the Stroganoff out of the oven, and April, wearing the same uniform as Holly—a black skirt, white shirt, and black bowtie—holding the Stroganoff, dashes out of the kitchen to serve the party guests. Holly calls after her, offscreen, as David walks past the hurrying April into the kitchen and walks over to Holly, who is busy at the pot-and-pan-covered stove. As Holly carries the quiche outside to the party, April comes back into the kitchen from another doorway, walks past David to a counter where she begins to fold napkins, and David leans back against the sink. They shake hands, and April walks offscreen to another area of the kitchen. Holly picks up a napkin from the crowded table, and David walks around the table, putting the plate of clams down on the already crowded surface. Holly follows him, chuckling, throwing her napkin into an offscreen garbage can as David stops at a small television set near the doorway. Guests in the other room can be seen chatting together in clusters, while canned laughter and miscellaneous chatter are heard from the television set. David watches the set, still munching on a clam, while Holly and April reassure him offscreen. David checks his wristwatch as Holly walks over to him, chuckles as David, listening to April, impressed, walks over to her, as she is standing by the table. April chuckles as Holly walks back onscreen, busy preparing another tray of hors d'oeuvres, and the three exchange glances. Holly shrugs, and a contemporary red building, designed by David, is seen, squeezed in between two older buildings. Holly, April, and David talk offscreen, and the film moves down from the buildings to reveal the trio sitting in David's Jaguar across the street, with David and April in the front seat and Holly scrunched up in back, her head slightly forward. David turns and briefly glances at Holly, then turns back to April. The screen, which has been exploring the rococo building's facade, now shows the equally elegant building alongside it. The film moves from the two elegant facades to show an ugly, ultra-modern structure covered with tiny, diamond-shaped motifs, then moves from the ugly facade to the building's equally ugly entrance, where a large car is parked right in front of the building. The group is now seen walking down the canopied entrance stairs of an apartment house on the other side of the street, where they'd been gazing at both the lovely and ugly facades across the way, with David in the lead, and the women follow, Holly slightly behind April. David leans over the roof of the car, looking at the women, waiting for their decision.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Holly, thrilled, sprints over to April, who is occupied retrieving the Stroganoff out of the oven, and April, donning the identical uniform as Holly—a black skirt, white blouse, and black bowtie—holding the Stroganoff, bolts out of the kitchen to serve the celebration invitees. Holly calls after her, offscreen, as David strolls past the rushing April into the kitchen and strides over to Holly, who is engaged at the pot-and-pan-covered stove. As Holly carries the quiche outside to the gathering, April returns into the kitchen from another entryway, strolls past David to a counter where she starts to fold napkins, and David reclines against the sink. They shake hands, and April departs offscreen to another section of the kitchen. Holly lifts a napkin from the crowded table, and David moves around the table, setting the plate of clams down on the already crowded surface. Holly follows him, giggling, tossing her napkin into an offscreen trash can as David pauses at a small television set near the doorway. Guests in the other room can be seen conversing together in groups, while canned laughter and miscellaneous chatter are heard from the television set. David watches the set, still chewing on a clam, while Holly and April reassure him offscreen. David checks his wristwatch as Holly walks over to him, giggles as David, listening to April, impressed, strides over to her, as she is standing by the table. April giggles as Holly walks back onscreen, occupied preparing another tray of hors d'oeuvres, and the three exchange looks. Holly shrugs, and a contemporary red building, designed by David, is seen, squeezed in between two older buildings. Holly, April, and David converse offscreen, and the film shifts down from the buildings to reveal the trio sitting in David's Jaguar across the street, with David and April in the front seat and Holly scrunched up in back, her head slightly forward. David turns and briefly glances at Holly, then turns back to April. The screen, which has been exploring the rococo building's exterior, now shows the equally graceful building alongside it. The film shifts from the two graceful facades to show an unattractive, ultra-modern structure covered with tiny, diamond-shaped patterns, then shifts from the unattractive facade to the building's equally unattractive entrance, where a large vehicle is parked right in front of the building. The group is now seen walking down the canopied entrance stairs of an apartment house on the other side of the street, where they'd been gazing at both the lovely and unattractive facades across the way, with David in the lead, and the women follow, Holly slightly behind April. David leans over the roof of the vehicle, looking at the women, waiting for their decision.

From the two elegant facades, the film moves to show an ugly, ultra-modern structure covered with tiny, diamond-shaped motifs, then the ugly facade is moved from to the building's equally ugly entrance, where a large car is parked right in front of the building. The group is now seen walking down the canopied entrance stairs of an apartment house on the other side of the street, where both the lovely and ugly facades across the way had been gazed at by them, with David leading, and the women following, with Holly slightly behind April. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Holly excitedly runs to April, who is taking the Stroganoff from the oven. Both wear matching uniforms—a black skirt, white shirt, and black bowtie. April rushes out to serve guests, while Holly calls after her. David enters the kitchen, passing April, and approaches Holly at the stove. Holly carries quiche outside, and April returns, folding napkins at the counter. David leans against the sink, they shake hands, and April exits. Holly picks up a napkin, and David places clams on the crowded table. Holly follows, chuckling, and throws her napkin away as David watches TV, eating a clam. Guests chat in the other room, with TV laughter in the background. David checks his watch, and Holly approaches, chuckling. David, impressed by April, walks to her by the table. April chuckles as Holly prepares hors d'oeuvres, and they exchange glances. Holly shrugs, and a red building designed by David appears between older buildings. The trio talks offscreen, then sits in David's Jaguar across the street, with David and April in front and Holly in back. David glances at Holly, then turns to April. The screen shows a rococo building facade, then an ultra-modern structure with diamond motifs and an ugly entrance. The group walks down apartment stairs, having observed the facades, with David leading and the women following. David leans over the car roof, awaiting their decision.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Holly excitedly runs to April, who is taking Stroganoff from the oven. Both wear black skirts, white shirts, and black bowties. April serves guests, while Holly calls after her. David enters, passing April, and joins Holly at the stove. Holly carries quiche outside as April returns, folds napkins, and shakes hands with David. Holly picks up a napkin, and David places clams on the table. Holly follows, chuckling, and throws her napkin away. David watches TV, eating a clam, while Holly and April reassure him. David checks his watch, and Holly approaches, chuckling. David, impressed by April, walks to her. They exchange glances, and Holly shrugs. A red building designed by David is shown between older ones. The trio talks offscreen, then sits in David's Jaguar, with Holly in the back. David glances at Holly, then turns to April. The screen shows elegant facades, then an ugly modern building with a large car parked in front. The group walks down apartment stairs, having observed the facades. David leads, with Holly slightly behind April. He leans over the car, waiting for their decision.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Holly, filled with excitement and energy, eagerly runs over to April, who is currently occupied with the task of carefully taking the Stroganoff out of the hot oven. April, dressed identically to Holly in a black skirt, crisp white shirt, and a neatly tied black bowtie, swiftly carries the Stroganoff and dashes out of the bustling kitchen to serve the eagerly awaiting party guests. As April hurries away, Holly calls after her from offscreen, just as David walks past the briskly moving April and enters the kitchen. He makes his way over to Holly, who is diligently working at the stove, which is covered with an assortment of pots and pans. Holly, balancing a quiche, carries it outside to the lively party, while April re-enters the kitchen through another doorway. She walks past David to a counter, where she begins the meticulous task of folding napkins, and David casually leans back against the sink. They exchange a friendly handshake, and April then walks offscreen to another part of the kitchen. Holly picks up a napkin from the cluttered table, and David moves around the table, placing a plate of clams on the already crowded surface. Holly follows him, chuckling softly, and tosses her napkin into an offscreen garbage can as David stops to watch a small television set near the doorway. In the other room, guests can be seen chatting in animated clusters, while canned laughter and various chatter emanate from the television. David, still munching on a clam, watches the set intently, while Holly and April offer him reassurance from offscreen. David checks his wristwatch as Holly approaches him, chuckling, and David, listening to April with interest, walks over to her as she stands by the table. April chuckles as Holly reappears onscreen, busy preparing another tray of hors d'oeuvres, and the three exchange knowing glances. Holly shrugs, and the scene shifts to show a contemporary red building, designed by David, squeezed between two older structures. Holly, April, and David continue their conversation offscreen, and the film transitions to reveal the trio sitting in David's sleek Jaguar across the street, with David and April seated in the front and Holly scrunched up in the back, her head slightly leaning forward. David turns to briefly glance at Holly before turning back to April. The camera, which has been exploring the ornate facade of a rococo building, now shifts to show the equally elegant building beside it. The film then moves from these two elegant facades to reveal an unattractive, ultra-modern structure adorned with tiny, diamond-shaped motifs, and then transitions from the unattractive facade to the building's equally unappealing entrance, where a large car is parked prominently in front. The group is now seen descending the canopied entrance stairs of an apartment house on the opposite side of the street, where they had been observing both the beautiful and unattractive facades across the way. David leads the way, with the women following, Holly slightly trailing behind April. David leans over the roof of the car, looking at the women, waiting patiently for their decision.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Holly, brimming with an infectious sense of excitement and energy, eagerly dashes over to where April is currently engaged in the meticulous task of carefully extracting the bubbling Stroganoff from the hot, radiant oven. April, whose attire mirrors Holly's with a chic black skirt, a crisp white shirt, and a neatly tied black bowtie, swiftly and expertly carries the Stroganoff, moving with a dancer’s grace as she exits the bustling, dynamic kitchen to serve the eagerly awaiting party guests. As April hurries out, Holly calls after her from offscreen, just as David walks past the briskly maneuvering April and makes his entrance into the kitchen. He makes his way over to Holly, who is diligently engrossed in her work at the stove, which is covered with a chaotic assortment of pots and pans. Holly, expertly balancing a quiche, carries it outside to the lively, buzzing party, while April re-enters the kitchen through a different doorway. She strides past David to a counter, where she begins the meticulous, methodical task of folding napkins, and David casually leans back against the sink, adopting a relaxed posture. They share a friendly handshake, and April then walks offscreen to another part of the kitchen. Holly picks up a napkin from the cluttered table, and David moves around it, carefully placing a plate of clams on the already crowded surface. Holly follows him, chuckling softly to herself, and tosses her napkin into an offscreen garbage can as David pauses to watch a small television set positioned near the doorway. In the other room, guests are visible, chatting in animated and lively clusters, while canned laughter and various chatter emanate from the television. David, still munching on a clam with evident enjoyment, watches the television set intently, while Holly and April offer him reassurance from offscreen. David checks his wristwatch with a casual glance as Holly approaches him, still chuckling, and David, listening to April with interest, walks over to her as she stands by the table. April laughs softly as Holly reappears onscreen, busy preparing yet another tray of hors d'oeuvres, and the three engage in exchanging knowing glances full of camaraderie. Holly shrugs, and the scene transitions to reveal a striking contemporary red building, designed meticulously by David, nestled between two older, more traditional structures. Holly, April, and David continue their engaging conversation offscreen, as the film fades into a scene showing the trio situated comfortably in David's sleek, polished Jaguar across the street, with David and April seated in the front and Holly, slightly scrunched up, leaning forward in the back. David turns to cast a brief, friendly glance at Holly before redirecting his attention back to April. The camera, which has been focusing intently on exploring the ornate facade of a visually striking rococo building, now shifts to display the equally elegant building beside it. The film then moves from these two distinguished facades to reveal an unattractive, ultra-modern structure adorned with tiny, diamond-shaped motifs and transitions seamlessly from the unattractive facade to the building's similarly unappealing entrance, where a large luxury car is parked prominently in front. The group is seen next, descending the canopied entrance stairs of an apartment house on the opposite side of the street, where they had been observing both the beautiful and unsightly facades across the way. David leads the group confidently, with the women following, Holly trailing slightly behind April. David leans over the car's roof, casting a look at the women, who are waiting patiently for their decision.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Holly, excited by the prospect of serving a dish from a renowned Russian cuisine, runs over to April, who is busy taking the Stroganoff out of the oven, the savory dish known for its beef and creamy sauce. April, wearing the same uniform as Holly—a black skirt, white shirt, and black bowtie, commonly worn by catering staff at upscale events—holding the Stroganoff, dashes out of the kitchen to serve the party guests, who are gathered in the elegant hall decorated for the evening's festivities. Holly calls after her, offscreen, as David walks past the hurrying April into the kitchen and walks over to Holly, who is busy at the pot-and-pan-covered stove in a bustling preparation for the evening's feast. As Holly carries the quiche, a classic French dish with a rich, savory filling, outside to the party, April comes back into the kitchen from another doorway, walks past David to a counter where she begins to fold napkins, a task often requiring precise folds for formal dinners, and David leans back against the sink. They shake hands, an informal but friendly greeting after a long day of preparations, and April walks offscreen to another area of the kitchen. Holly picks up a napkin from the crowded table, and David walks around the table, putting the plate of clams, a popular seafood appetizer, down on the already crowded surface. Holly follows him, chuckling at the relentless pace of serving, throwing her napkin into an offscreen garbage can as David stops at a small television set near the doorway. Guests in the other room can be seen chatting together in clusters, while canned laughter, typical of sitcoms from the '80s and '90s, and miscellaneous chatter are heard from the television set. David watches the set, still munching on a clam, while Holly and April reassure him offscreen about the night's successful progress. David checks his wristwatch as Holly walks over to him, aware that punctuality is key to the event's smooth running, chuckles as David, listening to April, impressed by her organizational skills, walks over to her, as she is standing by the table. April chuckles as Holly walks back onscreen, busy preparing another tray of hors d'oeuvres, such as bite-sized pastries and canapés, and the three exchange glances. Holly shrugs, and a contemporary red building, designed by David, an architect known for his modernist approach, is seen, squeezed in between two older buildings that display classical architectural styles. Holly, April, and David talk offscreen, and the film moves down from the buildings to reveal the trio sitting in David's Jaguar, a symbol of luxury and status, across the street, with David and April in the front seat and Holly scrunched up in back, her head slightly forward, indicating the limited space. David turns and briefly glances at Holly, then turns back to April. The screen, which has been exploring the rococo building's facade, now shows the equally elegant building alongside it, both landmarks in the city's historic district. The film moves from the two elegant facades to show an ugly, ultra-modern structure covered with tiny, diamond-shaped motifs, a divisive new addition to the neighborhood, then moves from the ugly facade to the building's equally ugly entrance, where a large car is parked right in front of the building. The group is now seen walking down the canopied entrance stairs of an apartment house on the other side of the street, a vantage point providing a full view of their architectural observations, where they'd been gazing at both the lovely and ugly facades across the way, with David in the lead, and the women follow, Holly slightly behind April. David leans over the roof of the car, looking at the women, waiting for their decision on their next destination in this evening filled with architectural tours and culinary delights.

The film moves from the two elegant facades to show an ugly ultramodern structure covered with tiny diamondshaped motifs then moves from the ugly facade to the building's equally ugly entrance where a large car is parked right in front of the building. The group is now seen walking down the canopied entrance stairs of an apartment house on the other side of the street where they would been gazing at both the lovely and ugly facades across the way with David in the lead and the women follow Holly slightly behind. April. David leans over the roof of the car looking at the women waiting for their decision.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Ginger, thrilled, slides over to Jasmine, who is busy tossing the lasagna out of the freezer, and Jasmine, wearing the same costume as Ginger—a green jacket, pink blouse, and green necktie—juggling the lasagna, skips out of the garage to amuse the opera singers. Ginger yells after her, offscreen, as Jonathan strolls past the skipping Jasmine into the garage and tiptoes over to Ginger, who is busy at the book-and-pillow-covered shelf. As Ginger drags the pie inside to the opera, Jasmine hops back into the garage from another window, strolls past Jonathan to a dresser where she starts to stack plates, and Jonathan leans forward against the drawer. They high-five, and Jasmine hops offscreen to another corner of the garage. Ginger picks up a plate from the crowded chair, and Jonathan skips around the chair, placing the basket of grapes down on the already crowded surface. Ginger follows him, giggling, tossing her plate into an offscreen basket as Jonathan halts at a large radio set near the hallway. Visitors in the other cabin can be seen whispering together in pairs, while canned applause and distant giggling are heard from the radio set. Jonathan stares at the set, still crunching on a grape, while Ginger and Jasmine comfort him offscreen. Jonathan checks his pocket watch as Ginger slides over to him, giggles as Jonathan, admiring Jasmine, astounded, skips over to her, as she is sitting by the chair. Jasmine giggles as Ginger slides back onscreen, busy arranging another bowl of desserts, and the three swap looks. Ginger shrugs, and a modern blue sculpture, crafted by Jonathan, is seen, tucked in between two ancient sculptures. Ginger, Jasmine, and Jonathan converse offscreen, and the reel floats down from the sculptures to show the trio resting in Jonathan's Chevrolet across the avenue, with Jonathan and Jasmine in the front seat and Ginger squished in back, her head slightly tilted. Jonathan turns and briefly looks at Ginger, then turns back to Jasmine. The camera, which has been exploring the baroque sculpture's surface, now shows the equally majestic sculpture alongside it. The reel moves from the two majestic surfaces to show a dull, ultra-ordinary statue adorned with tiny, triangular carvings, then moves from the dull statue to the sculpture's equally dull doorway, where a large bicycle is parked right in front of the statue. The group is now seen strolling down the sheltered doorway steps of a cottage on the opposite side of the avenue, where they'd been staring at both the stunning and dull sculptures across the lane, with Jonathan in the lead, and the ladies trailing, Ginger slightly behind Jasmine. Jonathan leans over the hood of the bicycle, glancing at the ladies, pondering their verdict.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Holly rushes to join April, who is serving Stroganoff to party guests, both in matching uniforms. As Holly takes a quiche outside, April returns to the kitchen, folding napkins while David enters, placing a plate of clams on the crowded table. They banter and watch TV, while offscreen laughter and chatter create a lively atmosphere. Holly, April, and David discuss an impressive building designed by David, visible between older structures, as they sit in his Jaguar parked nearby. They observe both elegant and modern facades across the street before leaving the apartment house, with David leading and Holly following. David pauses, glancing at the women, awaiting their decision.
